168407.title: Fatima's Coochee-Coochee Dance
168407.plot: The dancer Fatima, well-known for her dancing shows at the World's Exhibition in 1893, performs for the camera. She opens her act by twirling around a few times, and then she does the 'muscle dance' for which she had attracted considerable notoriety.

178696.title: McKinley at Home, Canton, Ohio
178696.plot: “This view was taken upon Mr. McKinley's lawn at his home in Canton, Ohio. Mr. McKinley appears walking across the lawn in company with his Secretary, who hands him a telegram, which he reads with apparent satisfaction. The characteristic walk and gestures of Mr. McKinley will be noted with interest by his friends.” (AMB Picture Catalogue)

178752.title: Poultry-Yard
178752.plot: Two girls do one of their chores. Standing alongside a tree-lined farmhouse, two children who are about ten and four years old toss grain to a flock of about 50 domesticated ducks. A woman watches them briefly and then moves on. The older girl has her grain in a bucket, the younger one's grain is in her apron. The children stay in one spot, as does the camera; it's the ducks that move around. Chickens are in the background; only one braves the ducks' territory.

178755.title: Arab Cortege, Geneva
178755.plot: A stationary camera looks across a busy corner toward a store front marked "The Divan." The words "des fees" are beneath. A cortege of Arabs, about 20 persons in the party, walk past; the dignitaries are in front, attended by men with horns and drums. Coming in the other direction are local Swiss, who pay little attention, and a group of native-garbed Africans. The dozen or so well-dressed denizens of Geneva who are sitting on the steps of the Divan take it all in.

178757.title: New York: Broadway at Union Square

178758.title: Chicago Police Parade
178758.plot: Walking four abreast, in groups of six rows, 144 of Chicago's finest parade past a stationary camera. Each of the six groups that pass is escorted by an officer. All are men, all are white, all look tall, all wear identical high-buttoned uniforms and badges and carry a nightstick. Almost all sport mustaches. Behind the police comes a horse-drawn carriage.

178989.title: Pompiers : attaque du feu
178989.plot: In the foreground, smoke billows. Four horse-drawn fire wagons approach and pass in front of a stationary camera. Two horses draw each wagon, and each wagon carries from two to eight firefighters. After the wagons pass, carts and pedestrians resume traffic on the street.

178991.title: Niagara Falls
178991.plot: A stationary camera looks west across Niagara Falls from the United States' side (the Niagara River rushes toward the falls from right to left). Virtually overlooking the falls and surrounded by the swift current not far from the camera is a small island where six or eight tourists watch the water, talk, and move about.

181379.title: Scene on the river Thames
181379.plot: A baby falls into the river

183263.title: Comic Costume Race
183263.plot: Three athletes make their way to wicker baskets that contain a mishmash of wacky costumes. They need to dress up as quickly as they can, and make their way back on the running track.

183273.title: A Sea Cave Near Lisbon
183273.plot: The water beats relentlessly against the Hell's Mouth (Boca do Inferno), one of the main natural attractions of Lisbon's west coast, filmed from above almost in a vertical plunge onto the deep, rocky ground.

183274.title: Andalusian Dance
183274.plot: Possibly the oldest surviving film shot in Spain, depicts Spanish dancers frantically doing their thing.

183277.title: Chirgwin in His Humorous Business
183277.plot: 'The White Eyed Kaffir' performs with top hat.

183293.title: Two AM; or, The Husband's Return
183293.plot: Husband comes home late and wakes the wife. Based on a popular stage play.

188398.title: The Melbourne Cup
188398.plot: This film documents the 1896 Melbourne Cup horse race including footage of the crowd watching the race.

189057.title: Amy Muller
189057.plot: Vaudeville dancer Amy Muller performs a portion of her stage routine, which features dancing on her toes. She dances on one toe for part of the performance. Later, she also twirls and does cartwheels.

189058.title: Shooting the Chutes
189058.plot: The camera shows a water ride at Bergen Beach at Coney Island. A raised track filled with water forms a chute, and a small boat full of park visitors slides down the chute. Alongside, empty boats are hauled back up to the top of the ride.

189059.title: Mess Call
189059.plot: Members of the New York state militia enjoy some relaxing time during a meal break.

189061.title: Watermelon Contest
189061.plot: Two men have a contest to see which one can be the first to eat a large slice of watermelon.

189268.title: Lone Fisherman
189268.plot: A fellow in a wide-brimmed hat, with a willowy stick for a rod and a baited hook, sits down on a plank hanging over a bridge above a stream. He sticks the rod under his seat and picks up his bottle to take a swig. Behind him creeps a joker who removes the large flagstone that's holding the fisherman's plank in place (IMDb)

189270.title: Interrupted Lovers
189270.plot: “The watchful father disturbs a dream of bliss, and the bucolic lover is taught a lesson. He made a great hit.” (Edison film catalog)

189579.title: Départ en voiture
189579.plot: Three women get in a horse-drawn carriage, as servants load luggage on the roof, before it pulls away.

189581.title: Ateliers de La Ciotat
189581.plot: Men working at the shipyards of La Ciotat.

189806.title: The Burning Stable
189806.plot: A burning wagon is dragged from the barn by the firemen, and four horses are rescued from the flames by the stablemen. Thick volumes of smoke pour from the doors and windows. (Edison catalog)

189807.title: Mounted Police Charge
189807.plot: "A battalion of New York's famous mounted police at inspection. They approach at break-neck gallop." - from the Edison Catalog

189809.title: Going to the Fire
189809.plot: A crowd watches the Newark Fire Department respond to a call.

189810.title: A Morning Alarm
189810.plot: “This shows the Fire Department leaving headquarters for an early morning fire. The scene is remarkable for its natural effect. The opening of the engine house doors, the prancing of the horses, and even the startled expression upon the faces of the spectators are all clearly depicted.” (Edison Films, 1897)

189812.title: American Falls from Above, American Side
189812.plot: The camera shows a view of the American Falls and Goat Island.

190553.title: Panorama du grand Canal pris d'un bateau

190554.title: Scene from the Coronation of the Czar of Russia
190554.plot: 100 seconds-long six-scene footage consisting of selected coronation ceremonies of the Russian Tsar (Emperor) Nicholas II. Shows distinguished guests entering a carriage, parade of troops and carriages, Nicholas II and his wife empress Alexandra Feodorovna descending the Kremlin Red Staircase, procession of the newly crowned Emperor and his wife under the baldacchino, guests from the Asian parts of the Russian Empire. (IMDb)

190555.title: Panorama de l'arrivée en gare de Perrache pris du train
190555.plot: A train arrives at Perrache station. We see the view from aboard the train.

190560.title: Lancement d'un navire
190560.plot: At the launch of a ship, of which we can only see the hull, the audience moves aside.

190563.title: London Street Dancers
190563.plot: Three young women dance in Drury Lane, London.

190564.title: Negro Street Dancers
190564.plot: Five black and white minstrels dancing and playing musical instruments in Rupert Street, London.

190565.title: Women Fighting
190565.plot: A quarrel between two women that a man attempts to separate.

190566.title: London, Cinematography Entry
190566.plot: The facade and the traffic in front of the Cinematographe in London, close to the large ensign of the historical Empire Theatre, in London.

190567.title: Enfants jouant aux billes
190567.plot: Game of marbles between four or five boys.

190570.title: Lyon : Quai de l'Archevêché
190570.plot: The floods of the Saône river during the first week of November, 1896.

190572.title: Course en sacs
190572.plot: Several competitors take part in a friendly sack race, with widely varying degrees of success.

190573.title: Arrivée d'un train à Perrache
190573.plot: A trains arrives at Perrache station and people disembark.

190580.title: Voltige
190580.plot: Considered a remake of Lumière's La Voltige from 1895.

190582.title: Black Diamond Express
190582.plot: This picture was taken at one of the curves on the Lehigh Valley Railroad, along the beautiful Susquehanna River. The train is seen rapidly approaching in the distance, clearly outlined against the grey mountains. Smoke can be seen pouring in volumes from the stack of the locomotive, and as the train approaches closely, she sounds a whistle, warning some section men, who are working on the tracks in the foreground. As she rushes by the camera, the swing motion of the train gives a vivid idea of the lightning speed at which she is traveling. (Edison film catalog)

190583.title: Joueurs de cartes arrosés
190583.plot: A friendly card game goes sour fast.

190585.title: Workers Exit from the Confiança Shirt Factory
190585.plot: A large number of workers, mostly young women, leave by the front door of their work place at lunch time. The building has an impressive colonnaded facade, and is located at 181, Santa Catarine St., Porto - one of the city's main streets. A passengers' horse cart crosses from right to left of the screen, and a few seconds after an ox cart carrying merchandise crosses in the opposite direction. All the while, workers keep leaving the factory, giving a sense of a large work force.

190592.title: Herald Square
190592.plot: Formed by the junction of Broadway, Sixth Avenue and 35th Street. The picturesque low roofed Herald building is plainly shown; also the passing crowds and group of idlers.

191588.title: Roi et Reine d'Italie
191588.plot: King Umberto I and Queen Margherita of Savoy stepping down a staircase, followed by their escort, before climbing into a horse-drawn carriage.

191594.title: Assiettes tournantes
191594.plot: Félicien Trewey, performing his spinning plates routine.

192797.title: Défilé de jeunes filles au lycée

193620.title: New York. Arrival of a Train at Battery Place

193625.title: Dresden, August-Brücke
193625.plot: A short film from the Lumière brothers, filmed in a Dresden street.

193630.title: Baby's First Steps
193630.plot: A mother takes her children for a walk, lifts her baby girl out of the buggy and gently sets her down to the ground. She then moves a few steps away and calls her name, to demonstrate that her baby can walk.

193631.title: Danse Tyrolienne
193631.plot: A Tyrolean dancing couple, accompanied by a musician, perform a traditional folk dance in a park in Cologne.

193646.title: Humorous Rollerskater
193646.plot: A roller skater performs a series of eccentric exercises.

193648.title: Repas d'indiens
193648.plot: Native Mexican people grouped in front of the camera.

193804.title: Pistol Duel
193804.plot: Based on a real event that occurred between two deputies, in Chapultepec Park.

194110.title: Writing Backwards
194110.plot: Félicien Trewey performs a trick by writing backwards the words "Ladies and gentlemen, my grateful thanks" on a board.

194112.title: The Bad Boy and the Gardener
194112.plot: A lady watering the garden with a hose, a mischievous boy stops the flow of water until she looks for the cause, when he permits the water to flow, resulting in the lady taking an unexpected bath. The father then appears and chastises the youthful culprit. One of the best films ever made.

194164.title: Débarquement
194164.plot: A short documentary clip released by Pathé Frères.

194165.title: Yarmouth Fishing Boats Leaving Harbour
194165.plot: Yarmouth Fishing Boats Leaving Harbour is an 1896 British short black-and-white silent documentary film, directed by Birt Acres, featuring a fleet of fishing smacks leaving the harbour at Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, UK. The "attractive Victorian film," was according to Christian Hayes of BFI Screenonline, "one of the twenty-one subjects presented by Birt Acres to the royal family on 21st July 1896, the day before the marriage of Princess Maud to Prince Charles of Denmark, at one of the very first royal film performances."

194167.title: Dr. Macintyre's X-Ray Film
194167.plot: The first X-ray cinematograph film ever taken, shown by Dr. MacIntyre at the London Royal Society (1896 and 1909). X-ray pictures of a frog knee joint, a beating human heart and movements of the stomach.

194168.title: Passaic Falls, New Jersey
194168.plot: A look at the waterfalls of the Passaic River in the northern New Jersey city of Passaic.

194169.title: New York, descente des voyageurs du pont de Brooklyn
194169.plot: New York, travelers descent of the Brooklyn Bridge

194171.title: New York, Whitehall Street
194171.plot: Pedestrians, carts and trams traffic, on Whitehall Street in New York.

194172.title: Alger : prière du muezzin
194172.plot: A short clip from the Lumière Brothers.

194175.title: Moscow, Tverskaia Street
194175.plot: Circulation of passers-by and cars in the paved street on the occasion of the Tsar's coronation.

194179.title: Serpentine Dance by Annabelle
194179.plot: Annabelle (Whitford) Moore performs her popular serpentine dance routine. She twirls around, and as she does so, she uses her long skirts to create a variety of patterns.

194182.title: Horses Bathing
194182.plot: Mexican vaqueros (cattle herders) in Guadalajara guide their horses through water.

194241.title: Géant et nain
194241.plot: A bout between a tall man and a dwarf.

194247.title: Bains de Diane (Milan)
194247.plot: A large pool in Milan has diving boards set at different heights. As some people watch from along the pool's edge, others enjoy themselves by diving into the pool, using a variety of different styles.

194249.title: Barcelone, panorama du port I
194249.plot: The camera sails off, giving us a view of the port from the water.

194252.title: Scaphandrier
194252.plot: A man in a diving suit emerges.

194253.title: Panorama pris d'un bateau
194253.plot: Panorama of the docks, the city and the bridge of a boat sailing the Rhine river in Cologne, Germany.

194255.title: Concert
194255.plot: On the terrace of a villa, a violinist, two pianists and a singer are playing, until they are interrupted by a false note.

194259.title: Arc de Triomphe
194259.plot: A Lumière Brothers short film showing a street scene in Paris.

194260.title: Woodcutters
194260.plot: Three men are chopping and transporting firewood, among passers-by, on a square in Lausanne.

194264.title: Budapest, pont suspendu
194264.plot: A Lumière Brothers film showing a street scene in Budapest.

194267.title: Cavalcade (char de la soierie)
194267.plot: A parade with large floats. One stops in front of the camera.

194269.title: Pont de bateaux
194269.plot: A crowd of passers-by is granted access to a drawbridge by its gatekeeper.

194270.title: Concours de bébés
194270.plot: A crowd of young children dance around.

194272.title: Cortège au mariage de la princesse Maud

194276.title: Cuirassiers à cheval
194276.plot: Cuirassiers charge the camera on horseback.

194281.title: Cyclistes et cavaliers arrivant au cottage
194281.plot: Cyclists and horse riders arriving at the cottage (1896)

194559.title: Départ de cyclistes
194559.plot: At the start line of the Lyon-Geneva bicycle race.

194561.title: Arrivée en voiture
194561.plot: A horse-drawn carriage stops in front of a villa. The residents greet the newcomers, as the coach driver unloads baggages.

194562.title: Lassage des bœufs pour le labour

194564.title: Levée de filets de pêche
194564.plot: A bunch of guys pulling a long rope out of the water, never revealing what its attached to.

194567.title: Repas des chats
194567.plot: Three cats take turns jumping up, in order to catch some food that a woman's hand is holding above their heads.

194569.title: La Canebière
194569.plot: Pedestrian, trams, carriages and carts traffic at the intersection of two streets on La Canebière in Marseille.

194574.title: Pompiers : sortie de la pompe
194574.plot: Several fire-carriages, presumably heading to a fire.

194577.title: Rome, pont Ripetta
194577.plot: A street scene in Rome from the Lumière Brothers.

194578.title: Vienne, entrée du cinématographe
194578.plot: People waiting in line for, what one can only assume, a Lumiere production.

194579.title: Voitures automobiles
194579.plot: Motor cars of different models, drivers, passengers and observers, all filmed from the starting line of the Paris-Meulan race.

194583.title: Alger: rue Bab-Azoun
194583.plot: Another street scene from the Lumiere company

194594.title: Les souverains et les invités se rendant au sacre (escalier rouge)
194594.plot: Sovereign Nicholas II and Alexandra Feodorovna and their suite slowly walk down a staircase, preceded by a company of cuirassiers.

194597.title: Maximilianeum
194597.plot: A street scene in Munich from the Lumière Brothers.

195082.title: Retour d’une promenade en mer
195082.plot: A boat returns to port, where passengers are helped ashore.

195098.title: Carpenters
195098.plot: In front of a building, five carpenters are working on woodworking machines.

195104.title: Rome, Wedding Procession of the Prince of Naples

196580.title: Pigeons sur la place Saint-Marc
196580.plot: A woman feeds pigeons on the Piazza San Marco in Venice.

198322.title: Embarquement
198322.plot: People board a leisure ship while porters ship their luggage in the town of Évian-les-Bains.

198362.title: Londres, Piccadilly Circus
198362.plot: A view of Piccadilly Circus in London.

212329.title: The Boxing Kangaroo
212329.plot: The Boxing Kangaroo is an 1896 British short black-and-white silent documentary film, produced and directed by Birt Acres for exhibition on Robert W. Paul’s peep show Kinetoscopes, featuring a young boy boxing with a kangaroo. The film was considered lost until footage from an 1896 Fairground Programme, originally shown in a portable booth at Hull Fair by Midlands photographer George Williams, donated to the National Fairground Archive was identified as being from this film.

230951.title: Radeau avec baigneurs
230951.plot: Young people dive into the sea by jumping off a manmade wooden raft, while a small boat loaded with passengers passes by.

230959.title: II. Inauguration
230959.plot: Released on October 4, 1896 in Lyon ( France ) under the title “ Fêtes de l'inauguration du monument de Guillaume Ier à Breslau : II. - Le voile tombe (Lyon républicain, 4 octobre 1896)”. (catalogue-lumiere.com)

230963.title: Venice Showing Gondolas
230963.plot: Shot of Venice from the Canal.

231035.title: Transport de la cloche de l'indépendance
231035.plot: The parade occupies only a small portion of the screen, the crowds are a seething mass that do really move and the Independence Bell is nowhere to be seen.

231040.title: Paris, Champs-Elysées (voitures)
231040.plot: Lumière Brothers film automobiles driving at the Champs-Elysées.

231055.title: Chicago, Grande Roue
231055.plot: A view of the Ferris wheel from the Chicago Exposition of 1893, turning slowly.

231061.title: Toulouse, rue Alsace-Lorraine
231061.plot: A street scene in Toulouse.  Catalog no. 157.

231064.title: Washing Day in Switzerland
231064.plot: Women and infants do laundry in this promotional film for Sunlight soap.

231065.title: Défilé du 8e bataillon
231065.plot: A battalion, preceded by three riders and a military marching band, parades in front of the crowd. A man is manoeuvring a handcart bearing the inscription "Sunlight Soap" in the foreground.

231070.title: Cherbourg : entrée des souverains russes et du président de la République sous le hall
231070.plot: Sovereign Nicholas II, Alexandra Feodorovna and President Félix Faure, walking by, followed by their respective escorts.

231101.title: Aquarium
231101.plot: Different species of fish and frogs, inside an aquarium.

231107.title: Lyon : sauvetage de lapins
231107.plot: Lyon, Men rescue rabbits from flood.

231114.title: Melbourne, les courses : sorties des chevaux
231114.plot: Horses and their riders make their way into the compact and agitated crowd of spectators.

231117.title: Melbourne, les courses : présentation du vainqueur
231117.plot: Coach W. Hickenbotham takes "Newhaven" out of his box and places the horse at the center of the paddock.  Gardiner, the jockey, saddles up the horse, rides it and begins to spin, slowly.

231120.title: Berlin, Hallesches Thor
231120.plot: A street scene in Berlin near Hallesches Tor.

231122.title: Alger : place du gouvernement
231122.plot: A street scene with a government building in the background.

231125.title: Chutes du Rhin vues de loin
231125.plot: A small boat is approaching waterfalls, shrouded in thick fog, in Neuhausen am Rheinfall, Switzerland.

231128.title: Bal d'enfants
231128.plot: A group of ten infant girls are on a playground. They are in pairs, matched in height. They are doing an organised dance. Each pair twirls simultaneously, while all five pairs rotate in a circular sequence. They often stop their circular rotation so that each pair can perform the same manoeuvre as the other four simultaneously. (IMDb)

231130.title: Dresde, vieux quartier à l'Exposition
231130.plot: Visitors at a historical fair in the mediaeval city of Dresden.

231375.title: Lyon : débarquement d'une mouche
231375.plot: Passengers leaving a ship in Lyon.

231433.title: Baignade de nègres
231433.plot: A group of black youths jumping from a dock into the water.

231464.title: New York, patineurs au Parc central

231469.title: Butterfly Dance
231469.plot: A very graceful dance with voluminous draperies, by Annabelle Moore, well-known on the metropolitan stage.

231591.title: Le Ring
231591.plot: A fixed camera gets images of traffic and passers-by in Vienna's chic thoroughfare, popularly known as Ringstrasse (The Ring), at a junction with another large street.

231592.title: Feira de Gado na Corujeira
231592.plot: Campinos on horseback drive small herds of cattle through the vast area of the traditional fair, before prospective buyers.

231593.title: The Turn-of-the-Century Barber
231593.plot: A barber's customer is not accustomed to the blade. Luckily, the coiffeur has a modern solution.

231595.title: Brighton Beach
231595.plot: People being fully dressed walking on the beach.

231596.title: Comic Encounter in the Djurgården
231596.plot: This is the first film ever filmed in Stockholm, Sweden. The part of the city featured is Djurgården (Tiergarten in German). It is where the unique outdoor museum Skansen is located.

231599.title: Il Finto Storpio
231599.plot: Men walk by as a dog lays about. Just out of view, a crippled man is begging for money.

231601.title: The Soldier's Courtship
231601.plot: Britain's first drama (i.e. non documentary) film.

231603.title: No Jardim
231603.plot: In a sunny open air setting with a background of high, deep foliage trees, and a white-walled storeyed house, an acrobat with light shirt and trousers and white plimsolls is doing acrobats in a trapeze in the center of the area. Behind it, a pair of men in similar dress seem to be carrying barbells from one place to the other, rather then exercising with them.

231608.title: Why Papa Cannot Sleep
231608.plot: "Shows papa walking the floor with a crying baby in his arms. An exceedingly laughable subject."

231694.title: Scènes d'enfants
231694.plot: Two children, playing in the garden, with a dog and a cat.

240240.title: Pompiers : mise en batterie
240240.plot: Firefighters at the scene lay out hoses and prepare to fight a blaze.

262852.title: Paris : les souverains russes et le président de la République aux Champs-Élysées
262852.plot: Russian sovereign Nicholas II and Alexandra Fiodorovna, and President Felix Faure, parading down the Champs-Elysées in a carriage, followed by horsemen.

263856.title: Cock Fight
263856.plot: Two cocks fight whilst being watched by two men.

265028.title: La foule sur la place de l’Opéra
265028.plot: A black and white short from the Lumière brothers in which a crowds is filmed at the Place de l'Opèra in Paris.

268211.title: Sortie d'une noce à l'église
268211.plot: A wedding party leave church in this Lumière brothers' short film.

268304.title: Enfants aux jouets
268304.plot: Three girls and a boy playing with their toys.

270384.title: Landing at Low Tide
270384.plot: Brighton. Landing of party from small boat with comic incidents.

270712.title: Boxing Match; or, Glove Contest
270712.plot: Staged boxing match between Sergeant-Instructor Barrett and Sergeant Pope, with a round, interval, and knockout.

273273.title: Dancing Darkies
273273.plot: "A company of little darkies showing off their paces to the music of the banjo."

282867.title: Tsar et tsarine entrant dans l'église de l'Assomption
282867.plot: While the crowd slowly moves forward, a company of guards and the Imperial dais enter the church.

302980.title: Bedtime for the Bride
302980.plot: A newlywed couple in front of their wedding-bed after their wedding. The woman undresses in front of her husband.  A French erotic short film considered to be one of the first erotic films made.

318787.title: Le président en promenade
318787.plot: A mounted Mexican president poses for the camera.

318789.title: Panorama de l’arrivée à Aix-les-Bains pris du train (temps de neige)
318789.plot: Panoramic film from the Lumiere Catalogue.

318790.title: Panorama pris depuis une plate-forme mobile

318793.title: Embarquement pour la promenade
318793.plot: Two women and a man come aboard a small boat. On the dock, friends and family are waving goodbye, until the boat moves out of focus.

318814.title: New York, Avenue et Union Square

320677.title: L'Impératrice mère et la grande-duchesse Eugénie en carrosse
320677.plot: Passage of three carriages, escorted by lackeys and soldiers.

320713.title: La Foule
320713.plot: The crowd gathers, on the lawn, in front of the grandstand.

320718.title: Arrivée du gouverneur
320718.plot: Governor Thomas Lord Brassey and his entourage walk past, under the watchful eye of the police and the cheers of the crowd.

320722.title: Enceinte du pesage
320722.plot: A man and a girl approach, while three riders pass in rapid succession across the field.

320734.title: La Course
320734.plot: The crowd gathered along the fence wave their hats at the passing riders, before slowly starting to clear.

320739.title: Arrivée d'un train à Melbourne
320739.plot: A train pulls into the station, and the crowd of travelers invades the dock.

321687.title: Abattage d'un arbre
321687.plot: Workers fill in a large hole left by an uprooted tree, while others pick up ropes.

321688.title: A Barc at the Sea
321688.plot: A small boat, with three men aboard, is shaken by the backwash.

321689.title: Enfant et chien
321689.plot: A small boy feeds his dog sugar cane by making him perform high jumps.

321690.title: Leçon de bicyclette
321690.plot: A young man explains to a small boy how to ride a bicycle.

321691.title: Marché
321691.plot: Passers-by on a street market in Marseille.

321692.title: Pêcheurs raccommodant les filets
321692.plot: Fishermen, sitting by a boat, are mending nets.

321693.title: Sardine fishing
321693.plot: Back from fishing, fishermen in a boat pull out sardines caught in the net.

321694.title: Repas en famille
321694.plot: A family consisting of father, mother and two children, sitting around a table and eating a meal.

321752.title: Sortie d'usine, [III]
321752.plot: Working men and women leave the Lumière factory, through the main gate. Three separate versions of this film exist, this is the second remake "no horse" version.

321753.title: La Bourse
321753.plot: Dense pedestrian, trams and cars traffic on the street, in front of the Palais de la Bourse in Marseille.

322611.title: Serpent
322611.plot: Félicien Trewey swirls a large white ribbon around him.

322617.title: Arroseur et arrosé, II
322617.plot: A gardener is watering his flowers, when a mischievous boy sneaks up behind his back, and puts a foot on the water hose. The gardener is surprised and looks into the nozzle to find out why the water has stopped coming. The boy then lifts his foot from the hose, whereby the water squirts up in the gardener's face. The gardener chases the boy, grips his ear and slaps him in his buttocks. The boy then runs away and the gardener continues his watering. Three separate versions of this film exist, this is the first remake.

323071.title: Un prêté pour un rendu
323071.plot: Two men are sitting on a park bench. One of them attempts to play a trick to the other, by tying up his handkerchief. In the end, however, the table is turned on him.

323083.title: Jongleur au ballon
323083.plot: A man performs a balancing act with a ball and a pair of sticks.

323266.title: I. Avant l'inauguration. Arrivée des souverains
323266.plot: Lancers parading, during the inauguration ceremony of William I's monument in Breslau, Germany (nowadays Wroclaw, Poland).

323274.title: III. Défilé de hussards devant Guillaume II
323274.plot: Several military companies parading, on foot, in front of Wilhelm II, in Breslau, Germany (nowadays Wroclaw, Poland).

323276.title: Guillaume II et Nicolas II à cheval
323276.plot: Wilhelm II and Nicholas II, on horseback, parade in front of the cheering crowd, during the inauguration ceremony of William I's monument in Breslau, Germany (nowadays Wroclaw, Poland).

323279.title: Görlitz : revue devant Guillaume II et Nicolas II
323279.plot: The German infantry parades in front of Nicholas II and Wilhelm II.

323287.title: Pont sur le Rhin
323287.plot: Pedestrian and vehicles traffic on the Mittlere Brücke in Basel, Switzerland.

325498.title: Leone XIII
325498.plot: Probably the first video of a Pope: Leo XIII blesses the viewers and makes a trip on his coach.

352902.title: Paris : chasseurs à cheval et spahis de l’escorte

352903.title: Paris : dragons de l’escorte
352903.plot: Dragon Parade, then passage of several carriages.

352905.title: Paris : général Saussier et son état-major

354010.title: A Heavy Sea
354010.plot: The rough sea crashing upon rocks.

357031.title: Our New General Servant
357031.plot: A wife dismisses a maid she hired when she finds her husband flirting with her. Allegedly the first film to ever use intertitles.

366954.title: New York, Broadway
366954.plot: A short black and white film in which a fixed camera records a busy New York street, Broadway.

374790.title: Arrival of a Train at Vincennes Station
374790.plot: A train arriving at Vincennes station.

385618.title: Little Egypt
385618.plot: "A well-known character, in a dance that created considerable excitement when first introduced in America."

386329.title: Danse mexicaine
386329.plot: A man and a woman dance "jarabe tapatío" while some people watch.

404013.title: Exercise a la baionette
404013.plot: Short about parading troops in Mexico.

404015.title: Marche Indien sur le canal de la Viga

415133.title: Venise, arrivée en gondole
415133.plot: People dismount and mount a gondola.

415434.title: The Hind in the Wood
415434.plot: The first hand-tinted movie, showing a group of dancers.

415650.title: The Broken Melody
415650.plot: A servant persuades a cellist to play and his errant wife returns.

426909.title: Ruraux au galop
426909.plot: A clip by Gabriel Veyre showing horses galloping at a Mexican festival.

426913.title: Le czar en France - défilé des troupes
426913.plot: The Czar in France - Procession of the troops.

426916.title: Arrivée d'un train
426916.plot: A train arrives at the station.

426919.title: Tramway à vapeur et passagers
426919.plot: A tram arrives to pick up passengers.

426920.title: Exposition nationale suisse. Palais des beaux-arts
426920.plot: A tram passes by a couple of times.

426922.title: Les bains de la jetée des pâquis

432571.title: Paris, rue de Castiglione
432571.plot: A Lumière street scene of Paris showing the traffic of horse carriages.

434878.title: Anes
434878.plot: An early Algerian film depicting donkeys

449097.title: A Victorian Lady in Her Boudoir
449097.plot: A young woman takes off several layers of clothing.

453069.title: Asian Delegations
453069.plot: Asian and Near Eastern diplomats and royalty file past the camera on their way to the coronation of Czar Nicholas II of Russia.

453070.title: Count of Montebello and General de Boisdeffre going to the Kremlin [Moscow]
453070.plot: The Count of Montebello and General de Boisdeffre arrive at the coronation of Nicholas II of Russia.

481560.title: Portuguese Railway Train
481560.plot: This short film – less than two minutes long – captures the arrival of the first train from Cascais to Cais do Sodré.

501925.title: O Vira
501925.plot: On a makeshift stage three pairs face-to-face in peasant clothes are dancing Minho's traditional step dance. The clothes are more close to Santarém folklore than the northern province of Minho.

510650.title: Ausfahrt nach dem Alarm
510650.plot: Fire brigade response to an alarm in Berlin.

519008.title: Cologne : sortie de la cathédrale
519008.plot: A short black and white film by the Lumiere brothers which captures the crowd at the Cologne Cathedral after the main religious services.

522775.title: Cologne : arrivée de l'express
522775.plot: A train arrives in Cologne Central Station and employees and travellers are seen on the platform.

525189.title: Londres : entrée de Hyde Park
525189.plot: Static shot of the traffic at Hyde Park Corner, London.

525193.title: Lassage d'un boeuf sauvage
525193.plot: Show of Mexican ranchers catching cows.

550861.title: Boats in the New York Harbor
550861.plot: A short film of boats sailing in the New York Harbor

550862.title: Review of U.S. Military
550862.plot: A short clip of United States military on horses

569468.title: Panorama of St. Mark's Square Taken From a Boat

579374.title: Empire State Express
579374.plot: The best-known "name" train of its day behind the most famous of all 4-4-0 locomotives, the 999---synonymous with speed in the early years of the century.

599660.title: Arrival of a Train (Joinville Station)
599660.plot: One of a few versions of the "arrival of the train" narrative. While the film is lost, there is a new digital version based on re-creation from a flipbook produced by Léon Beaulieu around the same time. Shot in Joinville-le-Pont

599683.title: A Serpentine Dance
599683.plot: A Serpentine dance performance, possibly featuring Loie Fuller (though the record is unclear). While the film is lost, there is a new digital version based on re-creation from a flipbook produced by Léon Beaulieu around the same time

602016.title: Vienna Street Scenes
602016.plot: Film produced by William K. Dickson’s British Mutoscope and Biograph Company.

602690.title: Children in the Nursery
602690.plot: Seen but not heard? Three children get up to mischief after their mother puts them to bed in this Victorian entertainment. This was one of numerous variations on the theme of 'naughty little boys or girls' in film's early years, demonstrating that Victorian ideals of child discipline didn't always match the reality.

607055.title: Irish Way of Discussing Politics
607055.plot: This is a typical Irish argument in which a can of beer, clay pipes and two sons of Erin form the principal parts.

614827.title: New York, Broadway and Wall Street
614827.plot: Movement of pedestrians, cabs, carts and trams at the crossroads of two avenues.

630022.title: Alger : déchargement au port
630022.plot: Porters bring goods into a warehouse.

642457.title: Francfort : réception de Guillaume II
642457.plot: Reception of German Emperor William II in Frankfurt am Main.

642460.title: Francfort-sur-le-Main, Alter-Marktplatz
642460.plot: The first recorded moving images of Frankfurt am Main.

665538.title: Devil's Dyke Fun Fair
665538.plot: Early film footage of fun fair workers and revelers at Devil's Dyke on the South Downs, taken by pioneer James Williamson in around 1896.

666580.title: Budapest : cortège du sceptre royal
666580.plot: These two views were taken during the celebrations given in 1896 on the occasion of the millennium of the foundation of the kingdom of Hungary. Horsemen and men on foot parade, all dressed in historic uniforms.

668449.title: Watering the Flowers
668449.plot: Watering the Flowers (French: L'Arroseur) was an 1896 French short comedy film directed by Georges Méliès. It was released by Méliès's company Star Film and is numbered 6 in its catalogues. The film was made in imitation of the more famous Louis Lumière film L'Arroseur Arrosé. It is currently presumed lost.

679786.title: Bains sur le Rhône
679786.plot: Bains sur le Rhône short film from 1896 by Louis Lumière.

680047.title: Tunis: Le Bey et son escorte

682215.title: Milan: The Rowers
682215.plot: View of a group of Milanese rowers. The video was made by the operator Giuseppe Filippi, the official dealer of the Lumière Brothers for the Italian territory.

692898.title: Umberto and Margherita of Savoy Strolling Through the Park
692898.plot: The royal family of Italy go for a walk in the park.

694185.title: Conjuring
694185.plot: The film reproduces a magic act Méliès performed at his Paris theater-of-illusions, the Théâtre Robert-Houdin.  Conjuring is notable as Méliès's second film, and as his first to move beyond the actuality film genre pioneered by the Lumière brothers and experiment with using the camera to capture a theatrical magic act. (Later in 1896, with his discovery of the substitution splice technique, Méliès was able to begin augmenting his theatrical illusions with new special effects unique to film.) Conjuring can thus be seen as Méliès's first foray into the world of fiction film.  The film was released by Méliès's Star Film Company and numbered 2 in its catalogues.

696642.title: A Corner of Barnet Fair
696642.plot: Shows a merry-go-round and some people sitting in a doorway while street traffic goes by.

697729.title: Wash Day Trouble
697729.plot: “Film could do more than record and recreate; it could invent new stories. Comic incidents like this were improvised from the earliest days, and developed later into slapstick comedy.” 35mm subject printed twice on reel - MoMA

710931.title: Sea Beach Scene
710931.plot: Some men are playing a game on the beach, while some ladies with their backs to the cameras watch. A donkey cart ambles by.

710935.title: Scene on Surf Ave., Coney Island
710935.plot: A short look at Surf Ave., Coney Island.

713297.title: Paul Nadar lisant l'Écho de Paris à la terrasse d'un café

722409.title: Ujazdów Avenue
722409.plot: Lost film by Kazimierz Prószyński. A shot of people walking on Ujazdow Avenue.

755952.title: Baigneurs en Seine à Paris
755952.plot: In a medium long shot, we see a view of the Seine, with some logs floating. Perhaps they are rubbish. Swimmers enter from the right, get as far as the logs and turn back.

759887.title: Soupe des soldats
759887.plot: Soldiers sit down and they're served food.

759889.title: Moutons entrant à l'abattoir
759889.plot: Sheep pass through a gate and enter a courtyard; a man counts them in passing.

764573.title: Snowball Fight
764573.plot: Early short of a snowball fight in the streets of Lyon, France

764845.title: Arrivée du Tzar à Paris
764845.plot: Tsar Nicholas II arrives in Paris.

764926.title: Voyage dans un train
764926.plot: A train ride with a view from the back of the train.

775149.title: Rochers de la vierge (Biarritz)
775149.plot: "These rocks, near Biarritz, are very well known. The scene shows the rough sea hitting their feet. There are no characters." Lumiere brothers

783247.title: Trilby and Little Billee
783247.plot: Based on Harper's Monthly short story, novel, and play, Trilby, by George Du Maurier. Considered the first book-to-film adaption.

791517.title: Miss de Vère - English Jig
791517.plot: A woman dances - preserved in flipbook form.

791522.title: Conjurer Making Ten Hats in Sixty Seconds
791522.plot: A man does tricks by forming hats and then putting them on. Fragment available in flipbook format, otherwise lost.

791889.title: A Soldier's Unlucky Salutation
791889.plot: A soldier is talking to a woman while sitting on a bench, a man sits on it, and the soldier stands up, causing the bench to tip over and the man falls.  Available in flipbook format only (tentatively identified) and otherwise a lost film.

814843.title: Bradford Town Hall Square
814843.plot: Very early film footage of Bradford from 1896

819805.title: The Tramp and the Dog
819805.plot: A tramp steals a housewife's pie, and is pursued by her bulldog, which latches onto his rear as he scrambles over a fence.

827807.title: New York, Broadway et Reade Street

832194.title: Rome, fin du cortège au mariage du prince de Naples

834236.title: Le président prenant congé de ses ministres

848977.title: Départ d’un bateau à vapeur sur le lac Léman

864931.title: Garde montante au palais de Buckingham

94570.title: The Kiss
94570.plot: They get ready to kiss, begin to kiss, and kiss in a way that brings down the house every time.

912687.title: Arrestation d'un ivrogne
912687.plot: A drunkard fooling around. Serious damage marks.

920680.title: La Zambelli
920680.plot: A dramatic dance, filmed by Paul Nadar in 1898. Preserved by Langlois' Cinematheque.

930138.title: Les démolisseurs
930138.plot: Alice Guy-Blaché's second film for Gaumont.

930211.title: Les congierges
930211.plot: Alice Guy-Blaché's third film for Gaumont.

964956.title: Vienna
964956.plot: street scenes of Vienna available here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NBCDQVM5t2w

104460.title: Playing Cards
104460.plot: Three friends are playing cards in a beer garden. One of them orders drinks. The waitress comes back with a bottle of wine and three glasses on a tray. The man serves his friends. They clink glasses and drink. Then the man asks for a newspaper. He reads a funny story in it and the three friends burst out laughing while the waitress merely smiles.

104462.title: A Terrible Night
104462.plot: A man tries to get a good night's sleep, but is disturbed by a giant spider that leaps onto his bed, and a battle ensues in hilarious comic fashion.

104466.title: The Vanishing Lady
104466.plot: Georges Méliès makes a woman disappear, then reappear.

104469.title: A Nightmare
104469.plot: A man has a fantastical nightmare involving, among other things, a grinning malevolent moon.

996346.title: The Arrival of a Train at La Ciotat [non-catalogued]
996346.plot: Probably filmed in 1895, a group of people stand along the platform of a railway station in La Ciotat, waiting for a train. The train pulls up and attendants help passengers off and on. This was not in the Lumière's official catalog, and was likely screened in early 1896.

998090.title: Sunderland
998090.plot: Poor pedestrian, horse drawn carts, wagons and bus travel across bridge at Sunderland, Tyne and Wear.

1016575.title: Vistas de Palermo
1016575.plot: Part of a documentary-type projections made in Argentina by Federico Figner.

1038027.title: McKinley and Hobart Parade at Canton, O.
1038027.plot: This is just at the title suggests. it's the McKinley and Hobart Parade at Canton

1067334.title: Pont du Mont-Blanc, Genève
1067334.plot: A view of the Mont-Blanc bridge in Geneva.

1073986.title: The Sprinkler Sprinkled
1073986.plot: The first remake of The Sprinkler Sprinkled, filmed in a much more elaborate garden from a different angle.

126413.title: Sandow
126413.plot: Strong-man Eugene Sandow flexes his muscles and strikes a few poses in front of a black background. This was a short film shot by William K.L. Dickson and produced in Thomas Edison's Black Maria studio.

127221.title: Blackfriars Bridge
127221.plot: R.W. Paul's early footage showing the new Blackfriars Bridge. It had been opened by Queen Victoria in 1869 for both road and rail, and showcases the distinctive Venetian Gothic ironwork.

129865.title: Demolition of a Wall
129865.plot: Auguste Lumière directs four workers in the demolition of an old wall at the Lumière factory. One worker is pressing the wall inwards with a jackscrew, while another is pushing it with a pick. When the wall hits the ground, a cloud of white dust whirls up. Three workers continue the demolition of the wall with picks.

133063.title: The Haunted Castle
133063.plot: Le Manoir du diable or The House of the Devil, released in the United States as The Haunted Castle and in Britain as The Devil's Castle, is an 1896 French short silent film directed by Georges Méliès. The film tells the story of an encounter with the Devil and various attendant phantoms. It is intended to evoke amusement and wonder from its audiences, rather than fear. However, because of its themes and characters, it has been considered to technically be the first horror film, as well as potentially the first vampire film.  The film opens with a large bat flying into a medieval castle, circling a room, and then suddenly changing into the Devil. Producing a cauldron, Mephistopheles conjures up a young girl and various supernatural creatures in an effort to scare two cavaliers, eventually succeeding in causing one to flee. Ultimately the remaining cavalier is confronted face-to-face by the Devil before reaching for and brandishing a large crucifix, which causes the Devil to vanish.

144462.title: Rip Van Winkle
144462.plot: An abridged version of the tale of Rip Van Winkle, a lazy American man, who wanders off one day with his dog Wolf into the Kaatskill mountains where he runs into an odd group of small men drinking and playing. He drinks some of their mysterious brew and passes out. When he wakes up under a tree he is astonished to find that 20 years have passed and things are a lot different.

146564.title: Exit of Rip and the Dwarf
146564.plot: A series of short black and white films from director William K.L. Dickson which chronicle the adventures of Rip Van Winkle.

147554.title: The Cabbage-Patch Fairy
147554.plot: A brief fantasy tale involving a strange fairy who can produce and deliver babies coming out of cabbages.  This film is lost or never existed. Copies of it online are actually the 1900 remake.

148236.title: Scenes at Balmoral
148236.plot: A short film with the first footage of Queen Victoria.  Other members of her family, including Tsar Nicholas II also appear.

152219.title: Feeding the Doves
152219.plot: A woman and a young girl each carry containers of bird feed, and they toss occasional handfuls to the chickens and doves in the farmyard. Most of the chickens stay nearby, but the doves occasionally fly off and then return to eat more.

152453.title: Children Digging for Clams
152453.plot: Children dig for clams on the beach

152454.title: Loading a Boiler
152454.plot: A stationary camera placed amidships looks toward the round end of a 10- or 12-foot boiler that's been loaded onto the open deck. Three men climb down from atop the boiler and then remove their ladder. Four or five other workers tie the boiler down to the deck. Their pace is leisurely. In the background is a busy harbor.

152455.title: Dragoons Crossing the Sâone
152455.plot: A stationary camera looks across Burgundy's river Sâone toward a small military encampment. Four horsemen enter the water in the foreground, each riding his horse as it swims across toward camp or leading it by the bridle as they swim

152456.title: Ostriches
152456.plot: An ostrich pulls a cart carrying young women wearing ostrich-feather hats.

152457.title: Childish Quarrel
152457.plot: Two babies are shown seated next to each other, in high chairs, apparently enjoying themselves. Suddenly one snatches a toy from the other and they indulge in hair-pulling.

152458.title: Lion, London Zoological Gardens
152458.plot: A male lion, right next to bars that are about 6 or 8 inches apart, keenly watches a uniformed zoo attendant toss small morsels of food into the cage. The lion alternates between finding the food on the cage floor and reaching through the bars to swipe at the man, who stays alarmingly close to the beast. In the background are the large rocks and brick wall at the back of the lion's habitat.

157328.title: Carmaux: Drawing Out the Coke
157328.plot: Carmaux is in south-central France, near the Tarn River. As a brick of coke, about four feet high and three feet wide, is gradually pushed out of a smelter into a yard, one worker sprays it with water from a hose while two workers with long metal rakes wait to spread it out. Other workers buzz in and out of the foreground of the stationary camera. Atop the first level of the brick smelter, workers push full carts of coal along a track.

159619.title: Partie de boules
159619.plot: Friends and relatives playing a game of boules, arguing about who's team is winning.

162767.title: Serpentine Dance
162767.plot: Angelic and demonic serpentine dances from dawn of cinema. The dancer is Loie Fuller; the pioneer modern dancer. Recorded in Paris, and hand-colored frame by frame.

163053.title: A Morning Bath
163053.plot: “Mammy is washing her little pickaninny. She thrusts him, kicking and struggling, into a tub full of foaming suds.” (Edison film catalog)

163064.title: Partie d'écarté
163064.plot: Three men are sitting around a table, two of them playing a game of Écarté. When the game is over, a domestic serves drinks.

163357.title: Bicyclist
163357.plot: Francis Doublier does bicycle tricks in the street.
